H0.text: What highly influential movement of artwork is considered established by Picasso, Braque, Metzinger and others in Paris, 1911. Fauvist

H1.text: What highly influential movement of artwork is considered established by Picasso, Braque, Metzinger and others in Paris, 1911. Surrealist

H2.text: What highly influential movement of artwork is considered established by Picasso, Braque, Metzinger and others in Paris, 1911. Expressionist

H3.text: What highly influential movement of artwork is considered established by Picasso, Braque, Metzinger and others in Paris, 1911. Cubist

A4.text: The movement was pioneered in partnership by Pablo Picasso and Georges Braque, and joined by Jean Metzinger, Albert Gleizes, Robert Delaunay, Henri Le Fauconnier, Juan Gris, and Fernand LÃ©ger.

A5.text: The term cubism is broadly associated with a variety of artworks produced in Paris (Montmartre and Montparnasse) or near Paris (Puteaux) during the 1910s and throughout the 1920s.
